name: Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation
explanation: Every mass attracts every other mass with force proportional to product of masses and inversely proportional to square of distance. This universal law explains orbits, tides, and gravitational interactions throughout the universe. Gravity is the weakest fundamental force but dominates on large scales. Used to calculate orbital velocities, escape velocities, and gravitational fields.

examples.problem: Earth (5.97×10²⁴ kg) and Moon (7.35×10²² kg) are 3.84×10⁸ m apart. What is gravitational force?
Why is gravity weak but dominates on large scales?
examples.solution: Gravity is always attractive and has infinite range, so large masses create strong fields
steps: Large masses (planets, stars) create significant fields
